item.title: 作家佩珀将科幻小说视为 "想象力的瑜伽
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，Ellen Huet 将与科幻小说作家 Eliot Peper 谈论科技领袖对科幻题材的兴趣。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet talks with science fiction author Eliot Peper about the interest tech leaders have in the sci-fi genre.】

item.title: 政府关门给美国经济带来阵痛涟漪
item.description: 我是驻华盛顿的白宫和国内政策记者格雷戈里-科特。今天我们关注美国政府关门对经济的影响。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册接收本新闻通讯，可以在这里注册。【原文：I’m Gregory Korte, White House and domestic policy reporter in Washington. Today we’re looking at how the US government shutdown is affecting the economy. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 美元无视所有厄运与悲观呼声
item.description:
今年早些时候，投资者排队押注美元贬值。现在，势头正在向有利于美元的方向转变。【原文：

Investors lined up earlier this year to bet against the US dollar. Now, momentum is shifting in favor of the greenback.

】

item.title: 法国建筑业巨头在困境重重的法国之外找到解脱之道
item.description: 法国最大的建筑公司正摆脱国内政治动荡的影响，进一步远离面临投资放缓和高税收威胁的国内市场。【原文：France’s biggest construction companies are shrugging off the political turmoil in the country as they move further away from a domestic market facing slower investment and the threat of higher taxes.】

item.title: 销售旺季伊始，特斯拉中国出货量上升
item.description: 随着中国汽车市场进入销售旺季，汽车制造商开始为实现年度目标进行最后冲刺，特斯拉公司上海工厂的出货量在9月份有所增加。【原文：Shipments from Tesla Inc.’s Shanghai factory increased in September as China’s car market kicks off its busy sales period and automakers start their final push to meet annual targets.】

item.title: 期权交易员正以罕见的速度转变为欧元的反对者
item.description: 由于法国政局动荡，期权交易商对欧元采取了几个月来最看跌的立场，本周欧元情绪急剧恶化。【原文：Sentiment toward the euro soured sharply this week as turbulent French politics prompted options traders to take the most bearish stance on the currency in months.】

item.title: 越南放开黄金市场，但因价格下跌购物者暂停购物
item.description: 在河内最繁忙的黄金交易街上，数十家店面的金条和珠宝闪闪发光。然而，周五，店主们闲坐在玻璃柜台后面，等待着顾客，因为越南结束了对金条贸易和生产长达数十年的垄断，这是十多年来市场的首次重大自由化。【原文：Along Hanoi’s busiest gold trading street, dozens of storefronts gleam with bullion bars and jewelry. On Friday, however, shopkeepers sat idly behind glass counters, waiting for customers as Vietnam ended its decades-long monopoly on bullion trade and production, the first major liberalization of the market in more than a decade.】

item.title: Wizz Air 在阿布扎比停业后重新安置约 200 名工人
item.description: Wizz Air Holdings Plc 计划将因阿布扎比业务关闭而受到影响的 450 名工人中的近一半重新安置到东欧的枢纽。【原文：Wizz Air Holdings Plc plans to relocate almost half of the 450 workers affected by the closing of its Abu Dhabi operation to hubs across eastern Europe.】

item.title: 英国央行行长：人工智能不会导致英国失业
item.description: 英国央行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）表示，人工智能的出现不会导致英国出现失业潮，尽管人们担心新技术已经在削弱对年轻工人的需求。【原文：The emergence of artificial intelligence will not lead to a wave of job losses in the UK, Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said, despite fears that the new technology is already sapping demand for young workers.】

item.title: 零售股跑赢 S&P 500 指数，交易飙升引发担忧
item.description: 个人投资者正以前所未有的速度购买股票，令大盘望尘莫及。但与此同时，交易量的激增也让人担心，散户最爱的仓位正变得拥挤不堪。【原文：Individual investors are buying stocks like never before and leaving the broader market in the dust. But at the same time, a surge in trading volume is raising fears that retail’s favorite positions are getting dangerously crowded.】

item.title: 多伦茨称，欧洲央行的行动有可能效力下降，但会更加频繁
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员普里莫兹-多伦茨（Primoz Dolenc）认为，结构性趋势有可能使欧洲中央银行的政策陷入困境。【原文：Structural trends are threatening to confound European Central Bank policy, according to Governing Council member Primoz Dolenc.】

item.title: 谷歌受到英国反垄断监管机构更严格的审查
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司成为首家在英国被指定为所谓战略市场地位的公司，从而使这家美国公司的在线搜索和广告业务受到英国反垄断监管机构的密切审查。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google became the first company to be designated with so called strategic market status in the UK, exposing the US firm’s online search and advertising business to a closer scrutiny by the country’s antitrust watchdog.】

item.title: 中国对高通公司的 Autotalks 交易展开反垄断调查
item.description: 中国国家市场监督管理总局周五表示，已对高通公司（Qualcomm Inc.【原文：China’s State Administration for Market Regulation has opened an antitrust investigation of Qualcomm Inc.’s acquisition of Autotalks, the regulator said on Friday.】

item.title: 英国将与乌克兰合作生产拦截无人机以对抗沙赫特人
item.description: 乌克兰和英国计划开始联合生产拦截无人机，以打击俄罗斯每天发射的沙赫特型无人机群，这些无人机对民用和能源基础设施造成了严重破坏。【原文：Ukraine and the UK plan to start joint production of interceptor drones to combat the swarms of Shahed-type unmanned aircraft launched by Russia on a daily basis, causing severe damage to civilian and energy infrastructure.】

item.title: 特朗普的 "生命线 "无助于提升米莱伊在阿根廷选民心目中的地位
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普为阿根廷提供的非同寻常的财政援助可能足以支撑当地市场，直至本月晚些时候举行关键的中期选举，但这对提高哈维尔-米莱伊总统在选民中的地位作用不大。【原文：Donald Trump’s extraordinary financial assistance for Argentina may be enough to shore up local markets until a key midterm election later this month, but it’s doing little to boost President Javier Milei’s standing with voters.】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡扎克表示欧洲应考虑联合国防预算
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员马丁斯-卡扎克认为，欧盟应将资源集中用于国防开支，并考虑通过联合发行债务来为共同预算提供资金。【原文：The European Union should pool its resources on defense spending and consider a common budget financed by jointly-issued debt, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.title: 法国市场回到政治风波之前的状态
item.description: 在埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）总统任命新总理前的几个小时，法国市场已从本周的政治风波中恢复过来。【原文：French markets have mostly recovered from the ructions of this week’s political drama, hours before President Emmanuel Macron names a new prime minister.】

item.title: 迪拜分类信息公司将在房地产热潮中评估 IPO 胃口
item.description: 总部位于迪拜的 Dubizzle 有限公司运营着深受外籍人士欢迎的分类信息网站，该公司计划下周开始评估投资者对首次公开募股的兴趣，为寻求利用迪拜蓬勃发展的房地产市场的公司浪潮再添一员。【原文：Dubai-based Dubizzle Ltd., which operates classifieds websites popular with expatriates, plans to start gauging investor interest next week for an initial public offering, adding to the wave of firms seeking to capitalize on the emirate’s booming property market.】

item.title: 阿拉伯联合银行计划出售 8 亿美元坏账
item.description: 阿拉伯联合银行（United Arab Bank PJSC）正在探索出售大约 8 亿美元的坏账，熟悉此事的人士称，这是海湾地区最近一家试图清理资产负债表的银行。【原文：United Arab Bank PJSC is exploring the sale of roughly $800 million in bad debt, people familiar with the matter said, the latest Gulf bank attempting to clean up its balance sheet.】

item.title: 中国将对美国船只征收港口费以示报复
item.description: 中国将开始对停靠在其港口的美国船只征收特别费用，从而使长达数月之久的争端明显升级。【原文：China will start levying special fees on American ships docking at its ports, significantly escalating a months-long dispute in which Washington has targeted the Asian country for its maritime and trade dominance.】

item.title: 约翰-甘孜谈美国对日本企业陷入恐慌的时代
item.description:
日本的恐慌与今天中国的担忧有何不同？【原文：

How the Japan panic was different to today's China worries.

】

item.title: 奇货可居：当美国被日本恐慌吞噬时（播客）
item.description: 这些天来，人们一直在担心中国及其占主导地位的公司会吃掉美国的经济午餐。当然，这并不是我们历史上第一次担心亚洲工业强国的崛起。20 世纪 80 年代和 90 年代初，人们对日本企业的崛起忧心忡忡。从《虎胆龙威》到迈克尔-克莱顿的小说《旭日东升》，这种担忧在电影和流行文化中随处可见。这次有一个很大的不同：中国【原文：These days, there’s a non-stop drumbeat of concern that China and its dominant companies will eat America’s economic lunch, so to speak. Of course, this isn’t the first time in our history that there were worries about a rising Asian industrial power. In the 1980s and early 1990s, there was a lot of concern about the rise of corporate Japan. And that fear was seen all over movies and pop culture, from Die Hard to the Michael Crichton novel Rising Sun. This time there is one big difference: Chine】

item.title: 油价暴跌，马来西亚国家石油公司分红将减少 38
item.description: 马来西亚国家石油公司（Petroliam Nasional Bhd.【原文：Petroliam Nasional Bhd.’s dividend payout to the Malaysian government is set to decline by 38% next year as an oil price slump weighs on the state-owned oil and gas company’s profitability.】

item.title: 税收取代石油收入，安瓦尔旨在削减马来西亚赤字
item.description: 马来西亚总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣（Anwar Ibrahim）计划削减更多补贴，改善税收，以缩小明年的预算赤字。【原文：Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim plans to cut more subsidies and improve tax collection to narrow the budget deficit next year, as he grapples with lower petroleum-related revenue and dimming economic prospects.】

item.title: 华尔街为何痴迷于贬值交易
item.description: 包括美国、法国和日本在内的一些世界最大经济体的政治和财政不确定性，以及这对其货币造成的压力，令投资者感到紧张。【原文：Political and fiscal uncertainty in some of the world’s biggest economies — including the US, France and Japan — and the pressure that puts on their currencies are making investors nervous.】

item.title: 日本统治集团崩溃将助日元一臂之力，并打击股市：策略师
item.description: 日本公明党结束了与执政党自民党的联合，导致日经 225 指数期货下跌，日元升值。【原文：Japan’s Komeito party has ended its coalition with the ruling Liberal Democratic Party, sending the Nikkei 225 futures down and boosting the yen.】

item.title: 泰国央行行长意外按兵不动后认为仍有放宽空间
item.description: 泰国央行行长威泰-拉塔那空（Vitai Ratanakorn）表示，泰国央行仍有政策空间来下调已经是世界最低基准利率之一的基准利率。【原文：Governor Vitai Ratanakorn said the Bank of Thailand still has policy space to cut a benchmark interest rate that is already among the world’s lowest.】

item.title: 贷款到期在即，Gaw Capital 就贷款方案举行会谈
item.description: 在下个月即将到期之际，专注于房地产的私募股权公司 Gaw Capital Partners 正在争分夺秒地为与上海房地产相关的 3.7 亿美元贷款进行再融资或展期。【原文：Real estate focused private equity firm Gaw Capital Partners is racing to refinance or extend $370 million in loans tied to properties in Shanghai as maturities loom next month.】

item.title: 交易员认为印度财报季最平静，因为他们看淡了 TCS
item.description: 塔塔咨询服务有限公司（Tata Consultancy Services Ltd.）的财报令人失望，但这并没有吓到市场，因为交易员们押注印度主要股票指数公司在本报告季的走势将趋于平缓。【原文：Tata Consultancy Services Ltd.’s earnings disappointment has failed to spook the market as traders bet on subdued moves among companies in India’s main equity index this reporting season.】

item.title: 保证金准入下调引发中国高价芯片股下滑
item.description: 由于投资者对估值过高和利润率下降的担忧与日俱增，高歌猛进的中国芯片制造商股票周五暴跌。【原文：High-flying Chinese chipmaker stocks tumbled Friday as mounting concerns over lofty valuations and reported margin cuts soured investor sentiment.】
